nirv.text:
Then you must not leave the body on the pole all night. Make sure you bury it that same day.
Everyone who is hung on a pole is under God’s curse. You must not make the land “unclean.” The Lord your God is giving it to you as your own.

interlinear.originalVerseText: #18=L לְ/הִתְעַלֵּֽם\׃\ \ס le./hit.'a.Lem to/ hide yourself H9005/{H5956}\H9016\ \H9018 HR/Vtcc H5956 H9005=ל=to/{H5956=עָלַם=to conceal}\H9016=׃=verseEnd\ \H9018=ס=section

nirv.text: Suppose you see your neighbor’s donkey or ox that has fallen down on the road. Then don’t act as if you didn’t see it. Help him get it up on its feet again.

nirv.text: A woman must not wear men’s clothes. And a man must not wear women’s clothes. The Lord your God hates it when anyone does that.

nirv.text: Suppose you happen to find a bird’s nest beside the road. It might be in a tree or on the ground. And suppose the mother bird is sitting on her little birds or on the eggs. Then don’t take the mother along with the little ones.

interlinear.originalVerseText: #26=L הַ/בָּנִֽים\׃ ha./ba.Nim the/ young ones H9009/{H1121H}\H9016 HTd/Ncmpa H1121H H9009=ה=the/{H1121H=בֵּן=son»son:9_youngAnimal)}\H9016=׃=verseEnd

nirv.text: You can take the little ones. But make sure you let the mother go. Then things will go well with you. You will live for a long time.

day: today : today/now
1) day, time, year
1a) day (as opposed to night)
1b) day (24 hour period)
1b1) as defined by evening and morning in Genesis 1
1b2) as a division of time
1b2a) a working day, a day's journey
1c) days, lifetime (pl.)
1d) time, period (general)
1e) year
1f) temporal references
1f1) today
1f2) yesterday
1f3) tomorrow

leb.text: So Barnabas and Saul returned to Jerusalem when they had completed their service, having taken along with them John (who is also called Mark).

Now there were prophets and teachers in Antioch in the church that was there: Barnabas, and Simeon (who was called Niger), and Lucius the Cyrenian, and Manaen (a close friend of Herod the tetrarch), and Saul.
And while they were serving the Lord and fasting, the Holy Spirit said, “Set apart now for me Barnabas and Saul for the work to which I have called them.”
Then, after they had fasted and prayed and placed their hands on them, they sent them away.

nirv.text: Barnabas and Saul finished their task. Then they returned from Jerusalem. They took John Mark with them.

In the church at Antioch there were prophets and teachers. Among them were Barnabas, Simeon, and Lucius from Cyrene. Simeon was also called Niger. Another was Manaen. He had been brought up with Herod, the ruler of Galilee. Saul was among them too.
While they were worshiping the Lord and fasting, the Holy Spirit spoke. “Set apart Barnabas and Saul for me,” he said. “I have appointed them to do special work.”
The prophets and teachers fasted and prayed. They placed their hands on Barnabas and Saul. Then they sent them off.
